intro: Psychotria effusa, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It contains alkaloids, including psychotrimine and cocaine, which are of interest in both botanical and pharmacological studies. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also subject to legal restrictions in many countries.
